comments.body: I hadn't realized we were calling "find references" in this test suite. That explains why the test was flaky, "find references" triggers a background cascade compilation. Generally, any discarded `Future[T]` is a likely source of flaky test failures. It's a good change to only test for definitions in `DefinitionLspSuite` üëç
This re-enables the test, but marks it as flaky

The purpose of this test was to document a known limitation when the dependency classpath was missing symbols that are referenced in the library sources. It looks like we bumped up the cats dependency to a version that brings in simulacrum ü§î

Either way, we could remove this test instea d
